name: DeArrow
description: Crowdsourcing better titles and thumbnails on YouTube
readme_summary: DeArrow is a browser extension that aims to combat sensationalism and inaccuracy in YouTube titles and thumbnails. It allows users to crowdsource and vote on better, more accurate titles and thumbnails, providing a cleaner and more informative viewing experience.
key_features: Crowdsourced titles and thumbnails for YouTube videos
User voting system for submitted titles and thumbnails
Configurable fallback options for titles and thumbnails
Option to format titles to user preference (e.g., sentence case)
Thumbnail generation service and local generation option
Ability to revert to original title and thumbnail
Cross-browser extension support (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
Group policy options for managed environments
primary_use_case: Improving the accuracy and reducing the sensationalism of YouTube video titles and thumbnails through a crowdsourced system.
cover_image_prompt: A wise librarian in a bustling digital archive, meticulously replacing garish, oversized movie posters with accurate, informative book covers. Each book cover represents a YouTube video, and the librarian is carefully selecting the best title and thumbnail from a collection of user-submitted options. Subtle UI elements displaying voting tallies and title formatting options are visible on a nearby holographic display. The scene is bathed in a clean, organized light, emphasizing clarity and truth. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear iconography and a modern, digital aesthetic, with the DeArrow logo subtly integrated into the archive's signage.

name: WhisperKitAndroid
readme_summary: WhisperKit Android brings on-device speech recognition capabilities to Android and Linux platforms, extending the functionality of the original WhisperKit from Apple devices. It allows for the transcription of audio directly on the device, offering a subset of features from its iOS counterpart with ongoing development and community contributions.
key_features: On-device speech recognition
Support for Android and Linux
Extends WhisperKit functionality
Experimental API with opt-in
Integration with QNN for hardware acceleration
primary_use_case: Enabling offline, on-device automatic speech recognition for Android applications.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot with a microphone headset, sitting at a clean workbench. The robot is holding a small, glowing Android device, and sound waves are visibly flowing from the device into the robot's ear. The robot is then 'speaking' or projecting text bubbles that contain transcribed words, clearly showing the conversion of spoken audio to text. Subtle digital particles and a small, unobtrusive UI element displaying 'WhisperKit Android' are visible on the workbench. The overall scene is bright, clean, and uses a modern, flat design with clear iconography, emphasizing ease of use and on-device processing. The background is a soft, abstract representation of a digital network.

name: homepage-lite
description: Homepage dashboard for managing and monitoring your homelab services and bookmarks.
readme_summary: Homepage-lite is a lightweight, Go-powered dashboard designed for managing and monitoring homelab services and bookmarks. It offers real-time status checks, system metrics, and a customizable modern UI with multiple themes.
key_features: Service Monitoring (real-time status checks, visual indicators)
Bookmark Management (organized by groups, custom abbreviations)
System Metrics (CPU, memory, disk usage with real-time updates)
Modern UI (responsive, multiple themes, custom backgrounds, Iconify integration)
Lightweight Design (single binary, low memory footprint)
primary_use_case: To provide a centralized, visually appealing, and easy-to-manage dashboard for home lab services, bookmarks, and system monitoring.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized digital assistant, resembling a smart home hub, stands at the center of a cozy, modern living room. The assistant is projecting a holographic interface displaying a clean, organized dashboard. This dashboard shows various glowing icons representing different home services (like a router, a server rack, a smart lightbulb) with clear 'UP' or 'DOWN' status indicators. Below these, organized sections show quick-access bookmark icons for popular websites. Subtle data streams flow from the assistant to these elements, indicating real-time monitoring. The overall mood is helpful and efficient, with a soft, ambient glow. The art style should be a clean, 3D isometric illustration with a bright, inviting color palette, emphasizing clarity and ease of use.

name: stremio-web
readme_summary: Stremio-web is a modern media center application built with JavaScript that allows users to discover, watch, and organize video content through easily installable add-ons. It provides a unified interface for accessing and managing various video sources.
key_features: Discover, watch, and organize video content
Utilizes easy-to-install add-ons for content integration
Modern media center interface
Built with JavaScript
Development and production build scripts
Docker support for deployment
primary_use_case: To serve as a unified, user-friendly interface for discovering and consuming video content from multiple sources via add-ons.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, bustling digital marketplace where diverse video content streams flow like rivers into a central, sleek media hub. A friendly, stylized character representing Stremio stands at the hub, skillfully directing these streams with glowing digital hands, organizing them into neat channels displayed on floating screens. Small, abstract icons representing add-ons float around, acting as conduits. The overall scene is clean and modern, with a focus on organized flow and accessibility, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with bright, inviting colors and subtle data particle effects.

name: audacity
readme_summary: Audacity is a free, open-source, cross-platform audio editor and recorder. It supports multi-track editing and is available for Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux, and other operating systems.
key_features: Multi-track audio editing
Audio recording
Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux)
Open-source (GPLv3 license)
primary_use_case: Editing and recording audio on a personal computer.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled sound engineer in a futuristic, minimalist studio, meticulously sculpting sound waves with glowing digital tools. The sound waves, initially chaotic and fragmented, are being shaped into a clear, harmonious melody. Input is represented by raw, unorganized audio waveforms on one side of the desk, and the output is a perfectly formed, vibrant sound visualization on a large screen. Subtle UI elements of Audacity's interface are visible on a secondary monitor. The scene is bathed in cool, ambient light, with digital particles flowing from the engineer's tools. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing clarity and precision.
